Medicine_tweet_61.News Finding: Consumption of #processed #meat may increase risk of #breast #cancer
Medicine_tweet_61.Paper Finding: Among participants who had the highest intake of processed meat, the incidence of breast cancer was 2.55 per 1,000 population per annum among those with low cooked vegetable intake and 2.35 per 1,000 per annum among those with high intake.
Medicine_tweet_61.News Context: Consumption of #processed #meat may increase risk of #breast #cancer
Medicine_tweet_61.Paper Context: This was due to the absolute risk already being higher in this sub-group; among participants who ate no processed meat, the incidence of breast cancer was 2.46 per 1,000 population per annum among those with low intake of cooked vegetables compared with only 2.01 per 1,000 per annum among those with high vegetable intake. Among participants who had the highest intake of processed meat, the incidence of breast cancer was 2.55 per 1,000 population per annum among those with low cooked vegetable intake and 2.35 per 1,000 per annum among those with high intake. There was no significant interaction with menopausal status.
Medicine_tweet_61.text:
REPORTED FINDING: Consumption of #processed #meat may increase risk of #breast #cancer
PAPER FINDING: Among participants who had the highest intake of processed meat, the incidence of breast cancer was 2.55 per 1,000 population per annum among those with low cooked vegetable intake and 2.35 per 1,000 per annum among those with high intake.
Medicine_tweet_61.displayed_text:
REPORTED FINDING: Consumption of #processed #meat may increase risk of #breast #cancer
PAPER FINDING: Among participants who had the highest intake of processed meat, the incidence of breast cancer was 2.55 per 1,000 population per annum among those with low cooked vegetable intake and 2.35 per 1,000 per annum among those with high intake.

Medicine_tweet_143.News Finding: Pretty convincing evidence of negative selection detectable in cancer exomes in contrast to Martincorena et al Cell 2017. Nice eg in TERT w +ve selection in promoter but -ve selection in exons. Makes good sense!
Medicine_tweet_143.Paper Finding: In summary, the presented evidence supports a major role of negative selection in cancer evolution, which has been neglected in most studies, and ultimately challenges the current paradigm of an exclusive role of positive selection in cancer.
Medicine_tweet_143.News Context: Pretty convincing evidence of negative selection detectable in cancer exomes in contrast to Martincorena et al Cell 2017. Nice eg in TERT w +ve selection in promoter but -ve selection in exons. Makes good sense!
Medicine_tweet_143.Paper Context: Interestingly, AP-1 is essential for MHC complex I downregulation and immune escape upon HIV infection . In summary, the presented evidence supports a major role of negative selection in cancer evolution, which has been neglected in most studies, and ultimately challenges the current paradigm of an exclusive role of positive selection in cancer. These studies help to shed light upon the mechanisms underlying immune evasion and provide insights for improving cancer immunotherapies in the future.

Medicine_283.News Finding: Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength.
Medicine_283.Paper Finding: In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females.
Medicine_283.News Context:
The benefits of circuit training

When it comes down to it, the benefits of circuit training are to burn fat and build muscle, Ryan says. Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength. Circuit training helps with building muscular endurance because there aren't any rests between exercises; you go from one move to the next.
Medicine_283.Paper Context: Third, studies involving both sexes may be needed to clarify the sex-based differences in the effect of such exercise on the calcaneus QUS status. In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females. These findings suggest that circuit training can help females attain significantly greater bone mass and muscle mass and may reduce their risk of osteoporosis or cardiovascular disease in later life.
Medicine_283.text:
REPORTED FINDING: Circuit training is also a great way to improve your muscular endurance and strength.
PAPER FINDING: In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females.
Medicine_283.displayed_text:

PAPER FINDING: In conclusion, I observed how circuit training at home can improve the calcaneus QUS status, such as QUS-SI, QUS-SOS, and QUS-BUA, as well as build muscle while losing fat mass through easy sports activities among young females.
